MS MCQs

    Introduction to securing data at rest on Azure - Secure data at rest in Azure SQL Database and Azure Cosmos DB

    »

    1. You’ve created a new SQL database. How can you enable encryption at rest for that database?

      Go to the portal, find transparent data encryption for Azure SQL Database, and turn it on.

      Use PowerShell to work with the SQL database, and use it to enable transparent data encryption.

      The SQL database already has encryption enabled. There’s nothing to be done.


    2. Keys are used to encrypt your Azure Cosmos DB data. What must you do with these keys to protect the data?

      You must copy these keys. You can then reuse the keys to help protect the data.

      You don’t have to do anything. The keys are rotated automatically.

      You must rotate the keys. The keys need to be changed periodically to help protect the data.
